body_html:
Hi @guptapriya, I don't know whether this last commit 89e0630 is supposed to solve the issue but the error is now changed into:

tensorflow/python/training/checkpoint_utils.py", line 334, in _set_checkpoint_initializer
    v._initializer_op = init_op._index[d]
AttributeError: 'Operation' object has no attribute '_index'

After some in investigation, I think that it doesn't handle the initialization of local variables such as moving mean in batch norm very well.
body_text:
Hi @guptapriya, I don't know whether  this last commit 89e0630 is supposed to solve the issue but the error is now changed into:
tensorflow/python/training/checkpoint_utils.py", line 334, in _set_checkpoint_initializer
    v._initializer_op = init_op._index[d]
AttributeError: 'Operation' object has no attribute '_index'

After some in investigation, I think that it doesn't handle the initialization of local variables such as moving mean in batch norm very well.
body:
Hi @guptapriya, I don't know whether  this last commit https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/commit/89e06304aad35bfb019a8c10f39fc1ead83e0f99 is supposed to solve the issue but the error is now changed into:
```
tensorflow/python/training/checkpoint_utils.py", line 334, in _set_checkpoint_initializer
    v._initializer_op = init_op._index[d]
AttributeError: 'Operation' object has no attribute '_index'
```

After some in investigation, I think that it doesn't handle the initialization of local variables such as moving mean in batch norm very well.
